results.adx_keywords: Assaults;United States Politics and Government;Connolly, Gerald E (1950- );House of Representatives;Fairfax (Va)
results.byline: By Luke Broadwater, Remy Tumin and Stephanie Lai
results.title: Staff Members Attacked With Bat at Congressman’s Virginia Office
results.abstract: Two people were hospitalized after the attack at the Fairfax office of Representative Gerald E. Connolly, a Democrat. A man was in custody, the police said.

media.caption: Representative Gerald E. Connolly, a Virginia Democrat, said a person armed with a baseball bat attacked two staff members at his district office in Fairfax on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid);Privacy;Genetics and Heredity;Conservation of Resources;Forensic Science;False Arrests, Convictions and Imprisonments;Surveillance of Citizens by Government;Search and Seizure;Civil Rights and Liberties;Research;your-feed-science;your-feed-animals;audio-neutral-informative;Nature Ecology & Evolution (Journal)
results.title: Your DNA Can Now Be Pulled From Thin Air. Privacy Experts Are Worried.
results.abstract: Environmental DNA research has aided conservation, but scientists say its ability to glean information about human populations and individuals poses dangers.

results.adx_keywords: Civil Rights and Liberties;Constitution (US);Reconstruction Era;Willett, Don R;Supreme Court (US)
results.title: 16 Crucial Words That Went Missing From a Landmark Civil Rights Law
results.abstract: The phrase, seemingly deleted in error, undermines the basis for qualified immunity, the legal shield that protects police officers from suits for misconduct.

media.caption: Judge Don R. Willett said that only the Supreme Court can grapple with the enacted text of the 1871 law and “decide whether it means what it says.”
media.copyright: Photo By Tom Williams/CQ Roll Call, via Getty

results.adx_keywords: Drivers Licenses;Automobile Renting and Leasing;Apologies;Citizenship and Naturalization;Hertz Global Holdings Inc;Louisiana;Puerto Rico
results.title: Hertz Apologizes After U.S. Citizen From Puerto Rico Is Denied Car Rental
results.abstract: Humberto Marchand was asked for his passport, though he produced a Puerto Rican driver’s license showing that he is from the U.S. territory. The rental company employee in Kenner, La., called the police.

media.caption: A Hertz counter at Kennedy International Airport in Queens. The car rental chain denied a Puerto Rican customer, automatically born a U.S. citizen, a car he had reserved at a New Orleans airport after he presented a driver’s license issued on the island instead of a passport.

results.adx_keywords: Padel (Sport);Pickleball (Sport);Chile;United States
results.title: Is Everyone Playing Padel Without Us?
results.abstract: Americans, bewitched by pickleball, are late to a global sports craze.

media.caption: If pickleball is Fahrenheit, padel is Celsius. It’s the centimeters to our inches, the football to our “football.”

results.adx_keywords: Diabetes;Diet and Nutrition;Artificial Sweeteners;Weight;Heart;Food;Sugar;World Health Organization;Physicians Committee for Responsible Medicine
results.title: World Health Organization Warns Against Using Artificial Sweeteners
results.abstract: Continued consumption doesn’t reduce weight and could increase the risk of Type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular diseases and mortality in adults, the W.H.O. said on Monday.

media.caption: Some alternatives to sugar, when consumed long term, do not serve to reduce body fat in either adults or children, the W.H.O. said in a statement on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;United States International Relations;Embargoes and Sanctions;International Trade and World Market;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Smuggling;Aeroflot Russian Airlines;Airbus Industrie;Boeing Company;Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By Ana Swanson and Niraj Chokshi
results.title: U.S.-Made Technology Is Flowing to Russian Airlines, Despite Sanctions
results.abstract: Russian customs data shows that millions of dollars of aircraft parts made by Boeing, Airbus and others were sent to Russia last year.

media.caption: Aeroflot planes in Moscow in early 2022. Data obtained by The New York Times shows that tens of millions of dollars of aircraft parts were sent to Russian airlines including Aeroflot after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
media.copyright: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Foreign Investments;Biden, Hunter;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Comer, James R;Republican Party;House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform;CEFC China Energy
results.title: House Republican Report Finds No Evidence of Wrongdoing by President Biden
results.abstract: After months of investigation and many public accusations of corruption against Mr. Biden and his family, the first report of the premier House G.O.P. inquiry showed no proof of such misconduct.
org_facet: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

media.caption: Republicans on the House Oversight Committee released their first report on an investigation into President Biden and his family on Wednesday.

results.byline: By Livia Albeck-Ripka and April Rubin
results.title: 3 People Killed and 6 Injured in New Mexico Shooting
results.abstract: The shooter, an 18-year-old, was killed by the police, the authorities said. Two police officers were among the injured.

media.caption: The Farmington Police Department said that it had responded to an active shooter situation on Monday and that multiple officers were involved “in an officer-involved shooting.”

results.title: Una estrategia para el dominio de un partido latinoamericano: la compra de votos
results.abstract: En las elecciones nacionales de Paraguay, el Times fue testigo de cómo representantes del gobernante Partido Colorado intentaban comprar los votos de las comunidades indígenas.

media.caption: Votando en una escuela de Pozo Colorado, Paraguay, en las elecciones celebradas en abril. Muchos votantes de esta región son miembros de comunidades indígenas.

results.adx_keywords: Turtles and Tortoises;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Rivers;internal-open-access-search;Chicago River
results.title: Meet ‘Chonkosaurus,’ the Thick Snapping Turtle Stealing Hearts
results.abstract: The gargantuan animal has enthralled thousands online after a kayaker on the Chicago River recorded it sitting on a rusted chain.

media.caption: A snapping turtle on the Chicago River was given a name befitting its enormous size: Chonkosaurus.

results.adx_keywords: Mayors;Politics and Government;Infrastructure (Public Works);Rap and Hip-Hop;Content Type: Personal Profile;Shah, Balendra (Balen);Kathmandu (Nepal);Nepal
results.byline: By Emily Schmall and Bhadra Sharma
results.title: From Rap Star to Engineer to Young Mayor Demolishing Swaths of Kathmandu
results.abstract: A music idol in his early 20s and then an engineer, Balen, 33, next won an upset victory as mayor of Nepal’s capital, inspiring a wave of young politicians. Now, he’s tearing down parts of the city.

media.caption: Balen, wearing his trademark black-on-black blazer and jeans, paired with small, square black sunglasses, in Kathmandu, in November.
media.copyright: Saumya Khandelwal for The New York Times

results.byline: By Sui-Lee Wee and Muktita Suhartono
results.title: In Blow to Junta, Thai Voters Overwhelmingly Back Opposition Parties
results.abstract: Thais on Sunday cast votes against their military leaders, backing instead a populist political mainstay and a progressive upstart bent on shaking up the status quo.

media.caption: Pita Limjaroenrat, leader of the Move Forward Party and prime ministerial candidate, in Bangkok on Sunday night.

results.adx_keywords: Campaign Finance;United States Politics and Government;Political Action Committees;Telemarketing;Conservatism (US Politics);Maichle, Kyle;Connors, John W (Political Operative);Lewis, Simon (Political Operative);Internal Revenue Service;Federal Election Commission;Republican Party;Wisconsin
results.byline: By David A. Fahrenthold, Tiff Fehr and Charlie Smart
results.title: How to Raise $89 Million in Small Donations, and Make It Disappear
results.abstract: A group of conservative operatives using sophisticated robocalls raised millions of dollars from donors using pro-police and pro-veteran messages. But instead of using the money to promote issues and candidates, an analysis by The New York Times shows, nearly all the money went to pay the firms making the calls and the operatives themselves.

results.title: Doyle Brunson, Poker Champion Known as ‘Texas Dolly,’ Dies at 89
results.abstract: In a lucrative career that began in the back rooms of Texas bars, he won back-to-back World Series of Poker titles (and 10 in all) and wrote a definitive poker manual.

media.caption: Mr. Brunson’s tournament winnings over his poker career exceeded $6 million.

results.title: DeSantis Signs Bill Defunding Diversity Spending in State Schools
results.abstract: The legislation is part of a broader Republican effort across the country to target D.E.I. programs.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida signed a bill on Monday that blocked state schools from using federal or state funding on diversity programs, addressing a concern of conservatives across the country.
media.copyright: Douglas R. Clifford/Tampa Bay Times, via Associated Press

results.title: After Decades of Drinks and Laughs, Is It Last Call at the Friars Club?
results.abstract: The New York headquarters of the legendary entertainment fraternity is facing the threat of foreclosure as its leaders look for a buyer willing to help keep the party going.

media.caption: For decades, the Friars Club in Manhattan has celebrated entertainers, particularly comics, but its headquarters is now up for sale and is facing the threat of foreclosure.

results.title: A New Mother, an Old Mother, a Love Story
results.abstract: We travel with our ghosts. Who better to lead us to what comes next?
